channel.title: Recording/Storing sequence in Axoloti
channel.description:
Hello,
I have a patch, which consists mainly on a series of filters with individual volumen controls, that I would like to sequence.
I'd like to work the sequence in an external dedicated interface, such as Live, Bitwig or similar, then 'store it' in Axoloti standalone, and being able to 'play it'.
First thing that comes to mind is of course a midi file, but I am unsure on how would I store it, and play it from within Axoloti in a manner that could be interpreted to drive the filters.
Any tips appreciated
Thank you

item.title: Recording/Storing sequence in Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

plagasul:

The midi player object requires a continuous "on" yellow signal. A manually permanently pressed button object works, but there must be an object that does this automatically, which is it? what object does provide that? It is difficult to find objects by functionality.

You can use a logic/change object for that. If you are using a dial to enter the value, then connect the dial to the blue inlet and then for the yellow inlet, connect the dial to a logic&change object and then to the yellow inlet. Everytime you turn the dial, it sends a trigger to the yellow inlet.
